TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpServerUtilityBase extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that provide helper methods for processing Web requests.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `writer` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.Execute%2A> method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `writer` object. For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.Execute%2A>.
